title.narrative: OUTPUT 29: SP SYSTEM STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Evidence-based strategies are in place to strengthen social protection policy, advocacy, legal and institutional frameworks, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more children from vulnerable families benefit from a social protection system

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Evidence-based strategies are in place to strengthen social protection policy, advocacy, legal and institutional frameworks

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the strengthening of the social protection system by working with Government and other partners to complete work on the draft social protection bill, and to finalize a coordination framework for the sector. The Integrated Social Services initiative is now in 100 districts. Strategic partnerships with CSOs are improving demand side interventions by empowering beneficiaries and communities to hold government accountable in the delivery of social protection services. Data analysis for the LEAP + ISS impact evaluation baseline has been completed. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/02/2022
